articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine said on Tuesday its biggest cross-border assault of the war to date had taken control of 74 settlements in Russia's region of Kursk and was still advancing, making gains of one to three km in the last 24 hours.
articles.title: Ukraine says it is still advancing in Russia's Kursk region, hints at 'next steps'

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Only a ceasefire deal in Gaza stemming from hoped-for talks this week would hold Iran back from direct retaliation against Israel for the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh on its soil, three senior Iranian officials said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Only Gaza ceasefire can delay Iran's Israel response

articles.author: Richard Cowan, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk is due to interview Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on the X social media network on Monday in an event that could inject more surprises into the turbulent U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Elon Musk to interview Trump on X social media network

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Tuesday approved the sale to Israel of different military equipment worth over $20 billion, the Pentagon said.
articles.title: Blinken approves sale to Israel of military equipment worth over $20 billion

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British authorities have now arrested more than 1,000 people following days of rioting involving violence, arson and looting as well as racist attacks targeting Muslims and migrants, a national policing body said on Tuesday.
articles.title: More than 1,000 arrested following UK riots, police say

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland
articles.description: Ukraine's military incursion into Russia had "created a real dilemma" for Russian President Vladimir Putin, U.S. President Joe Biden said on Tuesday, adding that U.S. officials are in constant touch with the Ukrainians about the move.
articles.title: Biden calls Ukraine incursion 'a real dilemma for Putin'

articles.author: Chayut Setboonsarng, Panarat Thepgumpanat
articles.description: Thailand's Constitutional Court will on Wednesday decide the fate of Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin, in a ruling that could see him dismissed after less than a year in office and plunge the country into deeper political uncertainty.
articles.title: Judgment day for Thai PM Srettha as court rules on dismissal case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado said on Tuesday that President Nicolas Maduro had "entrenched himself" with the nation's top military leaders in order to stay in power after last month's disputed election.
articles.title: Venezuela's Machado says Maduro relying on military to stay in power

articles.author: Lais Morais
articles.description: Forensics experts at Sao Paulo's morgue had by Tuesday identified the bodies of 35 of the 62 people who were killed in a plane crash in a residential area of Vinhedo last week, killing all aboard, authorities said.
articles.title: Brazil plane crash victims being identified and flown home

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Russian forces on Tuesday struck back at Ukrainian troops with missiles, drones and airstrikes in actions that one senior commander said had halted Ukraine's advance after the biggest attack on sovereign Russian territory since the war began.
articles.title: Russia strikes back at Ukrainian forces in Kursk region
